definition[0]: to give someone more control over their own life or situation
example[0]: The Voting Rights Act was needed to empower minority groups.
definition[1]: to give a person or organization the legal right to do something
example[1]: The president is empowered to appoint judges to the Supreme Court.
definition[2]: to give a person or an organization the power or the legal right to do something
example[2]: The President is empowered to appoint judges to the Supreme Court.
